etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin, literally ‘carrier’, from vehere ‘convey’

definitions: a quantity having direction as well as magnitude, especially as determining the position of one point in space relative to another.
shortDefinitions: quantity having direction as well as magnitude

definitions: a matrix with one row or one column.
shortDefinitions: matrix with one row or one column

definitions: denoting a type of graphical representation using straight lines to construct the outlines of objects.
shortDefinitions: denoting type of graphical representation using lines to construct outlines of objects

definitions: an organism, typically a biting insect or tick, that transmits a disease or parasite from one animal or plant to another.
shortDefinitions: organism that transmits disease or parasite from one animal or plant

definitions: a bacteriophage or plasmid which transfers genetic material into a cell, or from one bacterium to another.
shortDefinitions: bacteriophage or plasmid which transfers genetic material into cell, or from one bacterium to another

definitions: a course to be taken by an aircraft.
shortDefinitions: course to be taken by aircraft

notes.text: with object and adverbial of direction

definitions: direct (an aircraft in flight) to a desired point

examples.text: two Hurricanes were vectored towards the Stukas

shortDefinitions: direct aircraft in flight to desired point
